greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest prime p such that 2*n+1 = 2*p + q for some odd prime q.
comment: Related to Lemoine's conjecture, which states that all odd integers > 5 can be represented as 2*p+q, p, q primes.
link: Hugo Pfoertner, Table of n, a(n) for n = 3..10000
xref: Cf. A002091, A103506 (smallest q), A046927, A195353 (positions of records), A195354 (records), A103153 (prime p=2 excluded), A185091.
results.author: _Hugo Pfoertner_, Sep 16 2011
